content.description: Start on the right side of the cliff and follow the obvious serpentine crack on the cliff face.
content.protection: Perfectly placed tree at the top of the cliff.

content.description: Instead of starting with the crack to the far right, start directly under the finish of The Kranken and climb straight up.
content.protection: Perfectly placed tree at the top of the cliff.

content.description: Start on the far right end of the cliff, with the Kranken, and climb straight to the top. Thin, technical holds that are made even more challenging by the heavy lichen covering this portion of the wall. Much harder for short people.
content.protection: 50 feet of static line allows you to tie to a tree farther back on the top of the cliff. The tree closest to the edge will create a pendulum effect if you fall.

content.description:
A single, secluded cliff amid a sea of chossy un-climbable nothingness. It is set in a ravine with a small stream. With very little breeze available, the bugs in the early spring are man-eating. Beautiful view of the Potomac though. 

  Update: Have found a handful of boulders with great potential. Will be cleaning and putting up lines over the fall season. Hope to have some new stuff posted soon.
